poem:
**Ephemeral Returns**

In the click of a mouse,  
desire takes form—  
a parcel on the doorstep,  
like prayer answered by machine.  

Yet the heart knows not  
its true need.  

Back go the dreams,  
in vain repentance,  
to the silence of warehouses,  
where the void waits quietly  
to swallow them whole again.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Serial returners send back £6.6bn of online purchases a year in UK, report finds Shoppers with a habit of returning goods bought online to retailers will send back £1,400 of products each this year, totalling £6.6bn, a UK report has found. Serial returners account for 11% of shoppers, but are on course to account for almost a quarter of the £27bn forecast returns this year, according to the report by the return logistics company ZigZag". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
